verses.verse: I made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with my eyes; <S%H5869><s%> why <S%H4100><s%> then should I think <S%H995><s%> on a maid? <S%H1330><s%>
For what <S%H4100><s%> portion <S%H2506><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> is there from above? <S%H4605><s%> and what inheritance <S%H5159><s%> of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> from on high? <S%H4791><s%>
Is not destruction <S%H343><s%> to the wicked? <S%H5767><s%> and a strange <S%H5235><s%> punishment to the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity? <S%H205><s%>
Does not he see <S%H7200><s%> my ways, <S%H1870><s%> and count <S%H5608><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> my steps? <S%H6806><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> I have walked <S%H1980><s%> with vanity, <S%H7723><s%> or if my foot <S%H7272><s%> has hurried <S%H2363><s%> to deceit; <S%H4820><s%>
Let me be weighed <S%H8254><s%> in an even <S%H6664><s%> balance <S%H3976><s%> that God <S%H433><s%> may know <S%H3045><s%> my integrity. <S%H8538><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> my step <S%H838><s%> has turned <S%H5186><s%> out of the way, <S%H1870><s%> and my heart <S%H3820><s%> walked <S%H1980><s%> after <S%H310><s%> my eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and if any blot <S%H3971><s%> has stuck <S%H1692><s%> to my hands; <S%H3709><s%>
Then let me sow, <S%H2232><s%> and let another <S%H312><s%> eat; <S%H398><s%> yes, let my offspring <S%H6631><s%> be rooted <S%H8327><s%> out.
If <S%H518><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> have been deceived <S%H6601><s%> by a woman, <S%H802><s%> or if I have laid wait <S%H693><s%> at <S%H5921><s%> my neighbor's <S%H7453><s%> door; <S%H6607><s%>
Then let my wife <S%H802><s%> grind <S%H2912><s%> to another, <S%H312><s%> and let others <S%H312><s%> bow <S%H3766><s%> down <S%H3766><s%> on her.
For this <S%H1931><s%> is an heinous <S%H2154><s%> crime; <S%H2154><s%> yes, it is an iniquity <S%H5771><s%> to be punished by the judges. <S%H6414><s%>
For it is a fire <S%H784><s%> that consumes <S%H398><s%> to destruction, <S%H11><s%> and would root <S%H8327><s%> out all <S%H3605><s%> my increase. <S%H8393><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> I did despise <S%H3988><s%> the cause <S%H4941><s%> of my manservant <S%H5650><s%> or of my maidservant, <S%H519><s%> when they contended <S%H7378><s%> with me;
What <S%H4100><s%> then shall I do when <S%H3588><s%> God <S%H410><s%> rises <S%H6965><s%> up? and when <S%H3588><s%> he visits, <S%H6485><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> shall I answer <S%H7725><s%> him?
Did not he that made <S%H6213><s%> me in the womb <S%H990><s%> make <S%H6213><s%> him? and did not one <S%H259><s%> fashion <S%H3559><s%> us in the womb? <S%H7358><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> I have withheld <S%H4513><s%> the poor <S%H1800><s%> from their desire, <S%H2656><s%> or have caused the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the widow <S%H490><s%> to fail; <S%H3615><s%>
Or have eaten <S%H398><s%> my morsel <S%H6595><s%> myself alone, <S%H905><s%> and the fatherless <S%H3490><s%> has not eaten <S%H398><s%> thereof;
(For from my youth <S%H5271><s%> he was brought <S%H1431><s%> up with me, as with a father, <S%H1><s%> and I have guided <S%H5148><s%> her from my mother's <S%H517><s%> womb; <S%H990><s%>)
If <S%H518><s%> I have seen <S%H7200><s%> any perish <S%H6><s%> for want <S%H1097><s%> of clothing, <S%H3830><s%> or any poor <S%H34><s%> without <S%H369><s%> covering; <S%H3682><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> his loins <S%H2504><s%> have not blessed <S%H1288><s%> me, and if he were not warmed <S%H2552><s%> with the fleece <S%H1488><s%> of my sheep; <S%H3532><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I have lifted <S%H5130><s%> up my hand <S%H3027><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the fatherless, <S%H3490><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> I saw <S%H7200><s%> my help <S%H5833><s%> in the gate: <S%H8179><s%>
Then let my arm <S%H3802><s%> fall <S%H5307><s%> from my shoulder <S%H7929><s%> blade, <S%H7929><s%> and my arm <S%H248><s%> be broken <S%H7665><s%> from the bone. <S%H7070><s%>
For destruction <S%H343><s%> from God <S%H410><s%> was a terror <S%H6343><s%> to me, and by reason of his highness <S%H7613><s%> I could <S%H3201><s%> not endure.
If <S%H518><s%> I have made <S%H7760><s%> gold <S%H2091><s%> my hope, <S%H3689><s%> or have said <S%H559><s%> to the fine gold, <S%H3800><s%> You are my confidence; <S%H4009><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I rejoice <S%H8055><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> my wealth <S%H2428><s%> was great, <S%H7227><s%> and because <S%H3588><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%> had gotten <S%H4672><s%> much; <S%H3524><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> I beheld <S%H7200><s%> the sun <S%H216><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> it shined, <S%H1984><s%> or the moon <S%H3394><s%> walking <S%H1980><s%> in brightness; <S%H3368><s%>
And my heart <S%H3820><s%> has been secretly <S%H5643><s%> enticed, <S%H6601><s%> or my mouth <S%H6310><s%> has kissed <S%H5401><s%> my hand: <S%H3027><s%>

This <S%H1931><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> were an iniquity <S%H5771><s%> to be punished by the judge: <S%H6416><s%> for I should have denied <S%H3584><s%> the God <S%H410><s%> that is above. <S%H4605><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I rejoice <S%H8055><s%> at the destruction <S%H6365><s%> of him that hated <S%H8130><s%> me, or lifted <S%H5782><s%> up myself when <S%H3588><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> him:
Neither <S%H3808><s%> have I suffered <S%H5414><s%> my mouth <S%H2441><s%> to sin <S%H2398><s%> by wishing <S%H7592><s%> a curse <S%H423><s%> to his soul. <S%H5315><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> the men <S%H4962><s%> of my tabernacle <S%H168><s%> said <S%H559><s%> not, Oh that we had of his flesh! <S%H1320><s%> we cannot <S%H3808><s%> be satisfied. <S%H7646><s%>
The stranger <S%H1616><s%> did not lodge <S%H3885><s%> in the street: <S%H2351><s%> but I opened <S%H6605><s%> my doors <S%H1817><s%> to the travelers. <S%H734><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> I covered <S%H3680><s%> my transgressions <S%H6588><s%> as Adam, <S%H121><s%> by hiding <S%H2934><s%> my iniquity <S%H5771><s%> in my bosom: <S%H2243><s%>

Did I fear <S%H6206><s%> a great <S%H7227><s%> multitude, <S%H1995><s%> or did the contempt <S%H937><s%> of families <S%H4940><s%> terrify <S%H2865><s%> me, that I kept silence, <S%H1826><s%> and went <S%H3318><s%> not out of the door? <S%H6607><s%>

Oh that one would hear <S%H8085><s%> me! behold, <S%H2005><s%> my desire <S%H8420><s%> is, that the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> would answer <S%H6030><s%> me, and that my adversary <S%H376><s%> <S%H7379><s%> had written <S%H3789><s%> a book. <S%H5612><s%>
Surely <S%H518><s%> <S%H3808><s%> I would take <S%H5375><s%> it on my shoulder, <S%H7926><s%> and bind <S%H6029><s%> it as a crown <S%H5850><s%> to me.
I would declare <S%H5046><s%> to him the number <S%H4557><s%> of my steps; <S%H6806><s%> as a prince <S%H5057><s%> would I go <S%H7126><s%> near <S%H7126><s%> to him.
If <S%H518><s%> my land <S%H127><s%> cry <S%H2199><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me, or that the furrows <S%H8525><s%> likewise <S%H3162><s%> thereof complain; <S%H1058><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I have eaten <S%H398><s%> the fruits <S%H3581><s%> thereof without <S%H1097><s%> money, <S%H3701><s%> or have caused the owners <S%H1167><s%> thereof to lose <S%H5307><s%> their life: <S%H5315><s%>

Let thistles <S%H2336><s%> grow <S%H3318><s%> instead <S%H8478><s%> of wheat, <S%H2406><s%> and cockle <S%H890><s%> instead <S%H8478><s%> of barley. <S%H8184><s%> The words <S%H1697><s%> of Job <S%H347><s%> are ended. <S%H8552><s%>
